job_description:
Business Data Analyst

Department: Product

Reports To: COO

Full Time – Exempt (Salary)

Location: Remote

Salary Range: $85,000 - $95,000

Company Description:

Hemster offers technology solutions to the fashion industry in order to optimize how clothes fit consumers, and helps brands maximize inventory productivity via data-driven refurbishment services. Hemster’s focus on technology innovation and sustainability is changing how consumers and brands view the garments they buy and produce.

Overview:

The Business Data Analyst supports the development of a data-driven culture, where analytical data is used to inform new strategies, develop operational improvements, and establish the evaluative framework for critical business initiatives. This role uses statistical methods, data modeling, analytical methodologies, and data analysis to develop and deploy tools including dashboards, infographics, reports, and models to inform and support decision-making. The individual will identify relevant data sets, analyze data, and support the development of KPIs to hold cross-functional teams accountable. Role will require developing a detailed understanding of the Company’s business model, objectives, issues, and challenges by interacting and collaborating with external users and internal stakeholders.

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work but is not inclusive of all duties, responsibilities or qualifications. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time based on business needs.

Responsibilities:

Data Collection and Analysis:
• Gather, clean, and analyze large volumes of data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
• Manipulate and adjust external data points to align with internal validation requirements.
• Utilize statistical methods to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
• Develop and execute “red-flag” data identification strategies to quickly identify concerns.

Report Generation:
• Create and generate regular reports for key stakeholders, highlighting relevant KPIs and performance metrics.
• Develop dashboards and visualizations to effectively communicate complex data findings.
• Provide context on dashboards and/or reports in external cross-functional meetings.

Business Strategy Support:
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide data-driven recommendations.
• Assist in the development and evaluation of business strategies based on data analysis.

Data Quality Assurance and Access Controls:
• Implement data quality checks and validation processes to ensure accuracy and reliability of data.
• Proactively identify and resolve data discrepancies or anomalies.
• Manage our Metabase platform to ensure proper user access.

Product Support
• Collaborate with Product to ensure that essential data points are being tracked and monitored for new product launches.

Continuous Improvement:
• Recommend and implement improvements to data collection and analysis processes.

Great-to-haves:
• Familiarity with multi-brand inventory catalog manipulations
• Experience providing data guidance to product and engineering
• Comfortable presenting data insights to company partners and external parties
• Deep understanding of Metabase Cloud
• B2B2C experience

Requirements:
• SQL fluency
• 2-3 years related work experience
• Strong time management and organizational skills
• Ability to read, write, and understand English
• Self-motivated and team-oriented
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills
• Good problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot problems.
• Strong organization skills, attention to detail and follow through to resolve any outstanding issues.

Position Type / Expected Hours of Work:

This is a full-time, exempt position. This position is not eligible for overtime. Work hours are typically 40 hours a week, Monday thru Friday.

COVID VACCINATION REQUIRED

Qualifications: Familiarity with multi-brand inventory catalog manipulations
Experience providing data guidance to product and engineering
Comfortable presenting data insights to company partners and external parties
Strong time management and organizational skills
Ability to read, write, and understand English
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Good problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot problems
Strong organization skills, attention to detail and follow through to resolve any outstanding issues
